The new model is called the BMW X3, and it's expected to start shipping in the second half of 2017.

The X3 will be available in three trim levels, starting at $69,990, $99,990, and $149,990, according to Edmunds.

The X3 will be available with a 2.0-liter turbocharged four-cylinder engine, and the base model will come with a 2.0-liter six-cylinder engine.

The X3 will also feature a six-speed manual transmission, and the base model will come with a six-speed automatic transmission. The BMW X3 will be available in six colors: black, silver, grey, red, and white.

The X3 will be available with a 60-percent driver assistance system, along with a driver assistance system with lane departure warning.

The X3 will be available with a 6.3-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and the base model will come with a 6.3-inch touchscreen infotainment system.

The X3 will come with a 15-inch display, and the base model will come with a 15-inch display.

The X3 will come with a 10-speaker audio system, and the base model will come with a 10-speaker audio system.
